meanings.definition: Stockbrokerages: firms that facilitate the buying and selling of stocks and other securities.
meanings.sent1: Many people invest in stockbrokerages to grow their money.
meanings.sent2: The stockbrokerages in the city are always bustling with activity.
meanings.sent3: The stockbrokerages had a sale on stocks, and everyone rushed to buy.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, stockbrokerages are like busy marketplaces.
meanings.sent5: She learned about stockbrokerages in her finance class and found them fascinating.

meanings.definition: Stockbrokerages: the act of engaging in the business of buying and selling stocks and other securities.
meanings.sent1: His dream job was to work in stockbrokerages and help people invest wisely.
meanings.sent2: She studied finance to understand the complexities of stockbrokerages.
meanings.sent3: The stockbrokerages competition was fierce, but he managed to succeed.
meanings.sent4: In the fast-paced world of stockbrokerages, timing is crucial.
meanings.sent5: The stockbrokerages industry is always evolving with new technologies.
